executedFeatures: Added labels to tensors are accessible through the "index()" method.
Tensors can be labeled and their labels can be used to extract slices / subsets of tensors.
Cross device sliced tensor integration test runs without errors.
thread pool executes given workload in parallel
Tensors try to migrate themselves to a device that is being added to them as component.
Tensors try to remove themselves from their device when "setIsOutsourced(false)" is being called.
The device of a tensor can be accessed via the "device()" method.
When creating slices of tensors then this should trigger a "parent - child" relation noticable to the device!
Gradient auto-apply kicks in when used AD uses JIT prop
Test JIT propagation variant one.
Test JIT propagation variant two.
Test autograd without JIT and auto apply.
Test in-differential and JIT with auto apply
Test no JIT prop when forward AD
Test no preemptive gradient apply when not requested and auto apply and JIT_prop
Test pending error optimization
Reshaping on 3D tensors works by instantiate a Function instance built from a String.
Tensor results of various Function instances return expected results.
A new transposed version of a given tensor will be returned by the "T()" method.
Auto reshape and broadcasting occurs.
Manual convolution produces expected result.
New method "asFunction" of String added at runtime is callable by groovy and also works.
New operator methods added to "SDK-types" at runtime are callable by groovy and also work.
Operators "+,*,**,^" produce expected results with gradients which can be accessed via a "Ig[0]" Function instance
Overloaded operation methods on tensors produce expected results when called.
The "dot" operation reshapes and produces valid "x" operation result.
Test integration broadly.
Parsed equations throw expected error messages.
Test parsed equations when building Function instances.
